Command line options

The right sintax for EasyMesh is:

EasyMesh NAME [options]

Where NAME is the name of the input file with or without extension.

The following command line options are available:

  • -d        create boundary triangulation only
  • -m        do not display any message
  • -r        generate mesh without relaxation
  • -s        generate mesh without Laplacian smoothing
  • +dxf      create drawing with Delaunay and Voronoi mesh in in Autodesk .DXF format
  • +fig      create drwaing with Delaunay and Voronoi mesh in .fig format for xfig
  • +example  create an example input file example.d

You must separate command line options with spaces. If none of the options is specified, the default values are assumed, which means that relaxation and smoothing will be applied, the messages will be displayed, and that neither the DXF or fig will be created.

As you can see there are only four command line options, from which the first three being more or less useless. So I think that in most cases EasyMesh will be used with +dxf option only. That is one of the reasons why the program is called EasyMesh.
